sen.j: 徳大寺 公城（とくだいじ きんむら、享保14年10月17日 (旧暦)（1729年12月7日） - 天明2年7月11日 (旧暦)（1782年8月19日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Kinmura TOKUDAIJI (December 7, 1729 - August 19, 1782) was a Court noble who lived during the mid Edo period.
Kinmura TOKUDAIJI (December 7, 1729 - August 19, 1782) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle Edo period.
sen.cmt: mid→middleに訂正しました。他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: Kinmura TOKUDAIJI (December 7, 1729 - August 19, 1782) was Kugyo (a Court Noble) in the middle Edo period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 主に桜町天皇（115代）・桃園天皇（116代）・後桜町天皇（117代）・後桃園天皇（118代）の四朝にわたり仕えた。
sen.e: He served at the Imperial Court during the reigns of four emperors: Emperor Sakuramachi (the one hundred-fifteenth Japanese emperor), Emperor Momozono (the one hundred-sixteenth Japanese emperor), Emperor Gosakuramachi (the one hundred-seventeenth Japanese emperor), and Emperor Gomomozono (the one hundred-eighteenth Japanese emperor).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He served for the four sovereigns: the 115th Emperor Sakuramachi, the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi and the 118the Emperor Gomomozono.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He served for the four sovereigns: the 115th Emperor Sakuramachi, the 116th Emperor Momozono, the 117th Emperor Gosakuramachi and the 118the Emperor Gomomozono.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 官位は従二位大納言まで昇った（薨去後従一位追贈）。
sen.e: His final official title was Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) with the rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank), and he was granted the rank of Juichii (Junior First Rank) after his death.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処原文に「大納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権大納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: He was promoted up to Junii - "Gon Dainagon" (Junior Second Rank and Provisional Chief Councilor of State); He was given the title Juichii (Junior First Rank) after he died.
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: He was promoted up to Junii (Junior Second Rank) Gon Dainagon (Provisional Chief Councilor of State); He was given the title Juichii (Junior First Rank) after he died.
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。

sen.j: 父は大納言徳大寺実憲。
sen.e: His father was Gon Dainagon Sanenori TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: 原文に「大納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権大納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: His father was "Gon Dainagon" Sanenori TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: 長い役職に""をつけました。
sen.e: His father was Gon Dainagon Sanenori TOKUDAIJI.
sen.cmt: タイトルの"を削除しました。

sen.j: 母は加藤泰恒（大洲藩主）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Yasutsune KATO (who was the lord of the Ozu Domain).
His mother was a daughter of Yasutsune KATO (who was the lord of the Ozu Domain).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Yasutsune KATO (who was the lord of the Ozu Domain).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 妻は松平頼恭（高松藩主）の娘。
sen.e: He married a daughter of Yoritaka MATSUDAIRA (who was the lord of the Takamatsu Domain).
He married a daughter of Yoritaka MATSUDAIRA (who was the lord of the Takamatsu Domain).
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He married a daughter of Yoritaka MATSUDAIRA (who was the lord of the Takamatsu Domain).

sen.j: 養子に右大臣徳大寺実祖がいる。
sen.e: His adoptive son was Udaijin (minister of the right) Sanemi TOKUDAIJI.
He had an adopted child, Sanemi TOKUDAIJI who became Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、訂正しました。
sen.e: He had an adopted child, Sanemi TOKUDAIJI who became Udaijin (Minister of the Right).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1740.
He was conferred a peerage in 1740.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: He was conferred a peerage in 1740.

sen.j: 以降清華家当主として速いスピードで昇進し、侍従・近衛府・近衛府・相模国を経て、寛延元年（1748年）に従三位となり、公卿に列する。
sen.e: Subsequently, he was quickly promoted as the head of a Seigake (which literally means "Seiga family," which refers to a family whose status was the second highest among noble families) and then he ranked among Court nobles with the rank of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 1748, after he experienced a chamberlain, Sakone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Ukone no Chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), and Sagami no Gon no Suke (provisional vice governor of Sagami Province).
sen.cmt: 原文に「近衛府・近衛府・相模国」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「左近衛少将・右近衛中将・相模権介」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1748, he achieved to become Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo; This happened after he experienced the positions of Chamberlain, "Sakone no Shosho" (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), "Ukone no Chujo" (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and "Sagami no Gon no Suke" (provisional vice governor of Sagami Province).
sen.cmt: 他の西園寺ファイルとの整合性から、表現を訂正しました。
sen.e: Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1748, he achieved to become Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo; This happened after he experienced the positions of Chamberlain, Sakone no Shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Ukone no Chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Sagami no Gon no Suke (provisional vice governor of Sagami Province).
sen.cmt: タイトルの"を削除しました。

sen.j: その後、中納言・踏歌節会外弁を経て、宝暦4年（1754年）に大納言となる。
sen.e: After that, he was appointed Dainagon in 1754 after he experienced Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) and Toka no sechie Geben (Court noble who conducted a Toka no Sechie [a ceremony held at the Imperial Court in January] outside the Jomei Gate).
sen.cmt: 原文に「中納言」とございますが、リンク先の用語となっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「権中納言」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Later, he was appointed Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) in 1754 after he served as "Gon Chunagon" (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) and "Toka no sechie Geben" (Court Noble who conducted "Toka no Sechie" [a ceremony held at the Imperial Court in January] outside the Jomei Gate).
sen.cmt: After that→Laterに訂正しました（after he served...があるため）。大納言の定訳を追加しました。長い役職、固有名詞に""をつけました。
sen.e: Later, he was appointed Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) in 1754 after he served as Gon Chunagon (Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) and Toka no sechie Geben (Court Noble who conducted Toka no Sechie [a ceremony held at the Imperial Court in January] outside the Jomei Gate).
sen.cmt: タイトルの"を削除しました。

sen.j: 宝暦6年（1756年）には大歌所別当となる。
sen.e: He became the chief of the Outadokoro (Folk Music Office) in 1756.
He became the chief of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office) in 1756.
sen.cmt: Outadokoroの前のtheを削除しました。
sen.e: He became the chief of Outadokoro (Folk Music Office) in 1756.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし宝暦7年（1757年）、朝廷への権力回帰の学説を主張した徳大寺家家臣竹内式部を桃園天皇の侍講につけた件で幕府から圧力がかかり、官職を辞して蟄居することとなった（宝暦事件）。
sen.e: In 1757, however, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) put pressure on him because he appointed a vassal of the Tokuraiji family named Shikibu TAKENOUCHI, who supported a theory that the Imperial Court should retrieve their political power, as a teacher of Emperor Momozono, and accordingly, he resigned his post and decided to stay at home (the Horeki Incident).

However, in 1757, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) put pressure on him for his misconduct that he appointed Shikibu TAKENOUCHI the tutor of the Emperor Momozono; For, Shikibu TAKEUCHI, who was a vassal of the Tokuraiji family, supported a theory that the Imperial Court should retrieve their political power; This incident forced Kinmura TOKUDAIJI to resign the position and to be suspended (the Horeki Incident).
sen.cmt: 文法整理と読みやすくするため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: However, in 1757, the Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) put pressure on him for his misconduct that he appointed Shikibu TAKENOUCHI the tutor of the Emperor Momozono; For, Shikibu TAKEUCHI, who was a vassal of the Tokuraiji family, supported a theory that the Imperial Court should retrieve their political power; This incident forced Kinmura TOKUDAIJI to resign the position and to be suspended (the Horeki Incident).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 安永7年（1778年）には赦免されているが、官職に服することはなかった。
sen.e: He was forgiven in 1778, but he never returned to any Court posts.
He was forgiven by the Edo bakufu in 1778; However, he no longer took any positions.
sen.cmt: 文法整理のため、訂正しました。
sen.e: He was forgiven by the Edo bakufu in 1778; However, he no longer took any positions.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし徳川幕府崩壊後の明治24年（1891年）には晴れて名誉回復。
sen.e: However, his honor was officially retrieved in 1891, after the Tokugawa shogunate was collapsed.
However, his honor was officially retrieved in 1891when the Tokugawa shogunate was collapsed.
sen.cmt: after→whenに訂正しました。

sen.cmt: 修正なし

He was given the title Juichii after he died.
